channel.title: Bangalore Clojure Group
channel.description: This platform aims at fostering collaboration among Clojure community members in Bangalore.

item.title: The hack-session meetup on Sept 1, 2018
item.description:
We hosted the 2nd episode of the hack-session during this Sept meetup at Nilenso office. 1st episode was during the Aug meetup.

Not only we had larger participation, Clojurians could also push their PRs to open-sourced projects. Some are in production already ðŸ™‚.

Here is what Clojurians built during the session:

  1. In/Clojure Website - Convert HTML to Hiccup (ClojureScript) - by Srihari Sriraman and Robert Christopher
  2. Bangalore Clojure Website
    • Auto update Meetups on the website - by Amarjeet and Govind Krishna
    • Make the website go live - by Robert Christopher
  3. Simple - Fuzzy Search - by Srihari Sriraman
  4. Time-tracker - by Abhinandan Kothari and Shafeeq
    • Makes Gstin and PAN optional
    • Sends email when user is invited
item.author: Amarjeet

item.title: Welcome to Bangalore Clojure Group
item.description:
Today, we are launching this website to enable greater level of engagement with the local Clojure community.

This launch was a part of the Hacking Session in today's meetup - in fact, I am writing this post in the ongoing meetup session ðŸ™‚

We plan to keep updating meetup details, along with talks' slides and videos. Stay tuned for updates.
item.author: Amarjeet
